column4: Does ATI work as well as nVidia ? (although I guess this is an opinion? )
in terms of there being drivers avalable
nvidia is most peoples preference, definately avoid ati
eh, hanging around here, I will tell you that if at all possible, avoid ATI
OK.
Why are the ATI drivers the work of the devil for linux ?
because ATI is closed source by nature
I thought the nVidia driver was too?
yes, but they actively develop the linux driver
at least better than ATI has tried
maybe, you haven't considered upgrading to a 450w or something?

Dell claims it will provide too much power to the motherboard if I was to upgrade and void my warranty.  Then they go on saying I can run a 9500GT rated at a 350watt min power supply that wouldn't void the warranty.
Now , as a cusomer..How am I supposed to make sense of that ?
that is a farce... lol,  more wattage doesn't mean more power persay,  in their sense of the word
that's what i say.. Why is it going to say "ooh look maw, I have a whole nother 150 watts I can use!! yay!! lets blow it!"
but we are also talking about dell here.
They tried to sell me an XPS also cause the "heat doesn't disapate in my systems setup"
on that note though, some dell's dont abide by ATX standards, so you should really investigate others attempts at upgrading
this isn't the slim version of the 530 Inspiron
The power supply is a Bestek ATXsomethingsomethingsoon
cool, have at it!
OK

some people have complained about the bestek in HP and Dell system , and Bestek in general saying no matter if I buy a video card the PSU is a "ticking time bomb" and needs to be replaced ASAP. *shrug*
